data.title: Great Pho and Bahn Mi's!!
data.text: The Pho here is great, really good flavor and lots of it. The Bahn Mi's are great too on really fresh rolls. Their egg rolls are fantastic!! This is a great place to eat! Good service too!!

data.title: Food is really good, service is lacking....
data.text: When arriving to Pho 71, there was only a couple of people there. We were unsure if we were to seat ourselves or not, then finally a waitress advised us where to seat. We were given menu's. As I began looking at them, they had tape over a lot of the prices and new prices written on the tape. The waitress came and took our drink order, and when she she brought it back it was can's of soda. Then she took our app order. I ordered Goi Cuon Ga Nuong which is Fresh Spring rolls with Grilled Chicken. They were really good. They came with a sauce that was really sweet.  It was kinda overwhelming to them. I also ordered Pho Tai. It was good, I wanted to try the Basil that was provided and it had an overwhelming mint flavor to it. I would prefer the Pho Tai without the Basil, but with the Bean spouts, Cilantro, and Peppers. I decided to share the Bun Bo Nuong which is a Vermicelli Noodles with Grilled Beef and it was really good. The sauce was nice on all the noodles, veggies, and beef. I had asked the waitress for the Cafe  Sua Da which is a Vietnamese Ice Coffee to be brought with the ticket at the end of the meal to go. She brought it out right after she brought out the entree's. So, when I finally was able to drink it, sad to say it was watered down and I was unable to really taste it. Throughout the meal, the waitress was hard to find and we ended up running out of drinks. I had to share with my husband and my son ran out of his too. I was frustrated when getting the bill to find out that we were charged for each can of soda that we drank. It didn't specify that on the Menu and the waitress didn't inform us of that.

data.title: VERY GOOD PHO
data.text: Is our go to place for pho and other Vietnamese dishes they offer. Have been there many times the past few years and they are always consistent with their food. I really like the pho and my wife likes the pho and the chicken and rice dishes they have. The service is always excellent and the staff are all very friendly. I like how fast the dishes come out once ordered. The prices are very reasonable and the place is clean although not the largest inside. Highly recommend eating there. We will continue to visit there often.

data.title: Hoboterp
data.text: The staff is friendly and provides great service . The food is excellent , by far the best Vietnamese in the Tulsa area .

data.title: Pho Sure!
data.text: We have Vietnamese friends who have served us some incredible authentic dishes, so we are pretty spoiled.  I gotta say though, when we are craving Pho or Spring Rolls, this place will hit the spot.  The staff is super courteous, too.  This is our Vietnamese restaurant of choice in Tulsa/BA.  I do wish that they would give a little bigger portion of peanut sauce when I get spring rolls to go....I'm always scraping the container for more!  YUM!

data.title: A favorite for my family
data.text: My husband, myself and our 4 children LOVE eating here. They have the best pho in town. We also love their fresh spring rolls. They make a great meal by themselves!

data.title: Hoboterp
data.text: The restaurant is small but quaint . By far the best Vietnamese food in Tulsa . The staff is friendly and professional. Do yourself a favor and visit this place .

data.title: Love the flavors
data.text:
If you like flavors, this is the place.  Get any of their noodle soups as they are delicious.  Put all the herbs, spouts, and rice noodles in it and you will say, "Where has this been all my life?"  Pho in a fairly new food to me within the last two years.  

And just because I called it soup, don't think you are going to leave hungry.  You might be able to eat all of a small one, you probably can't eat all of a medium one, and NO WAY can you eat all of a large.  And although you can possibly eat too much, there is no guilty feeling when you are done.  We LOVE this place.  This is a must try!

data.title: Pretty Disappointed
data.text:
After reading all the good reviews, my wife and I decided to stop by after work to try it out. Now to be honest we didn't try the Pho so I can't rate that, but I got the porkchop plate and my wife got the bun cha goi which is her go to plate for Vietnamese food.

To begin with my plate, I need to say, I don't know if it is normal for this place but it was sad. The pork chop was so tiny and thin, and the overall portions were pretty small. For the price of the dish I was surprised how little they served. The taste was very average at best.

My wifes plate was not what she expected either. She has ordered it in many other restaurants and they always had alot of fresh vegetables and herbs along with the egg rolls, beef balls, fish cake, and other little goodies. This place served her 2 egg rolls and Juliand cucumber and vermicelli noodle. Now granted it was about 75 cents cheaper than other places, I can honestly say I would rather pay more for better food.

I don't want to step on the toes of the other people who gave such great reviews but I don't know why my experience at this restaurant was so disappointing!

The staff was polite but unfortunately that could not make up for the lack luster food!

We will not be going back.

data.title: Very solid Vietnamese at a reasonable price
data.text: Best fresh spring rolls I've ever had. I get the grilled pork (#A6) and always ask for extra meat. They are incredibly tasty as is the peanut sauce which is served warm. Very nice. I love their vermicelli dishes. I don't do pho as much but the couple of times I've had it, it was very good. The only thing holding back from a 5 rating is the atmosphere. If it was a little cozier, rather than stark white, I would give it a 5.

data.title: Standard Pho
data.text: This noodle house is right around the corner from the house and I eat here often. They are closed on Tuesdays and I'm always caught by surprise at this. The pho has become bland and flavorless at times. The bahn mi sandwiches are just ok. This is a popular lunch spot and is often crowded on weekends. I like this place because it's close and go here only if I'm being lazy and do t want to drive to a better pho noodle house. Give it a try. It is good.

data.title: Outstanding Pho!
data.text: Pho 71 is arguably the Tulsa area's best place to get pho. The service is friendly, and the portions are HUGE. I echo Charles' statement in that the medium is typically a large for other places. The only strange thing is they sell soda by the can. It kind of caught me off guard, but it definitely isn't anything to complain about. I'll go here again and again!

data.title: Pholicious
data.text: One of the better  pho places in  Tulsa.  Normally  I  get the P1 a mix of all the beef  meat choices. The servings size is very generous the medium  is a large  in a lot of places.  The service  is good  also. Price is  fair  for what you get.  Well  worth the  stop.

data.title: Oodles of Vietnamese Noodles and vegies
data.text: My wife won't let us go a whole month without getting Pho Ba. I also like to snag a Cafe Sua Da {Vietnamese Coffee} here.

data.title: Great Pho
data.text: My husband and I come here regularly for pho. He generally gets beef and I get the chicken. It's all very delicious!  Also very nice staff and a clean environment.

data.title: Pho, bahn mi, coffee
data.text:
There are several new Pho places in East Tulsa, BA, so we decided to try this one. I am always on the search for real Vietnamese egg rolls, cha gio, the homemade kind with pork, shrimp, carrots, dried mushrooms. The Pho 71 website had photos that looked right but the ones we got seemed to be frozen pre packaged ones. The fresh spring rolls going to some tables looked fresh but we had not ordered those. So I was disappointed in that. I think Re Li still does the best job on those.
We both ordered pho, one small, one extra large. Good hot broth although a bit watery-I think it needed to simmer longer. Plenty of fresh basil, cilantro, bean sprouts. We ate all the meats, then separated the noodles from the broth and I will reheat for a second meal. I will be using some beef tenderloin slices and concentrate the broth. Yum. 
We also ordered the pork bahn mi. Good bread and the pork was flavorful but tough.But it just wasn't complete. The sliced carrots, Daikon radish had not been marinated, no sauce or pate on the bun, little seasoning. 
The place was empty when we came in at 11:30 but it filled up by noon with diners and carry out patrons. Many people ordered coffee so that might be a good option also. A little more attention to detail and this could be a really good Vietnamese restaurant.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: If you enjoy pho you will really like this place.  They have a good selection and the service is very good and quick.  Whether you're looking for a good and quicker lunch option or just to sit and enjoy a meal, this is a good place.  It is minimally decorated, but that's ok because it's still comfortable and you come to a place like this for the food anyway.  Give this place a try.

data.title: Good Pho
data.text: Seven of us ordered different items and we were all pleased.  I've been here a few times and been happy with the food each time.  It's probably not going to be a life-changing meal for you, but you can count on the food being decent each time, the prices are good, service is friendly, restaurant is clean and overall you'll be satisfied.
